ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course provided an overview of various research methods, though there is a marked emphasis on experimental methods.
I learned how to insightfully and critically choose a research design and construct a research method.

I gained some knowledge about different research methodologies and practical tips for carrying them out. I also learned about the combination of different methodologies and their strengths/weaknesses.
How to construct a research proposal, from RQ to methods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course provides a useful reading list of works to reference for various research methods. However, reading about a method is not particularly effective. The class would have benefitted greatly from a problem set component or a replication exercise so that the students could get practice actually conducting analysis using that method. Though the final project was meant to address this somewhat, it is hard to conduct original work and analysis in one semester because it often requires building a data set. Therefore, those students who do not start the class with data or a very well-defined research design don't get the most out of this class because they don't get the opportunity to practice implementing the methods.
No weaknesses all strengths. Prof Mousa is the G.O.A.T. of research methodology.

Strengths: feedback on written work, Professor Mousa was very knowledgeable about the various methods + especially experimental ones
Weaknesses: lack of student discussion (felt a little bit more like an undergrad course), syllabus readings were not as interesting as I would have liked
Strength: Working on our final paper throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Salma is an excellent professor.
Not particularly, though most of my reservations were with the style of the teaching. Therefore, if another faculty member redesigns this course, it may be worthwhile.

I would recommend this course with reservations. It feels much more like a research design course than a course on how to utilize mixed methods. For the most part, each week is dedicated to learning about how to use a different method to accomplish a research goal or accommodate a certain kind of data. But it is not a course to really teach the art of *mixing* methods, which I am still a little bit unsure about.
Yes, this course is perfect for students who are ready to kick-start a research project.
